headline: Uber will need to fingerprint drivers in California to transport teens
summary: Uber has 30 days to require certain drivers to get fingerprinted if the ride-hail giant intends to continue transporting unaccompanied teens in California. The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) issued a ruling Thursday that requires taxi and ride-hail drivers who are carrying unaccompanied minors in the state to pass a fingerprint background check. The ruling also requires transport companies to pay for the cost of those background checks. Uber has a history of fighting back against

headline: Uber and Lyft Stocks Plunge As Google's Waymo Brings Driverless Taxis to Miami
summary: Google said it is bringing its Waymo self-driving taxis to Miami, news that sent Uber and Lyft stock prices lower as investors weighed the risk to their services.

raw.headline: Uber and Lyft Stocks Plunge As Google's Waymo Brings Driverless Taxis to Miami

headline: Uber Stock Is Falling Because  Waymo Is Expanding to Florida
summary: The driverless ride-hailing platform says it will bring its vehicles to Miami early next year. It aims to offer services for customers in 2026.

raw.headline: Uber Stock Is Falling Because  Waymo Is Expanding to Florida
raw.summary: The driverless ride-hailing platform says it will bring its vehicles to Miami early next year. It aims to offer services for customers in 2026.

headline: Google bringing Waymo robotaxis to Miami. Uber, Lyft shares falling.
summary: Both rideshare icons Uber (UBER) and Lyft (LYFT) are seeing their shares fall by over 10% each on Thursday after Google (GOOG, GOOGL) announced it will be expanding Waymo's robotaxi services to Miami in 2026. Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton report more on this news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Uber and Toast Partner to Boost Delivery Reach for US Restaurants
summary: On Thursday, Toast, Inc. (NYSE:TOST) expanded its partnership with Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:UBER) to give restaurants more choices and provide guests with additional delivery options. This collaboration aims to help restaurants reduce costs and expand their reach. Integrating Toast Delivery Services with Uber Direct will enable U.S. restaurants to cut delivery fees, extend delivery reach, and utilize Uber’s vast delivery network, the company said in the press release. headline: 'Had To Uber To The Funeral Home And Beg For A Ride' – This Family Says Dave Ramsey's No-Credit Advice Failed Them
summary: Dave Ramsey has built a name for himself as the financial guru who preaches a simple, no-nonsense approach to money: ditch the credit cards, pay off your debt and live within your means. Millions have embraced his advice, cutting up their credit cards and committing to his cash and debit-only spending philosophy. But for one former Ramsey follower, this rigid system left them in a devastating bind during a family emergency. Don't Miss: Can you guess how many Americans successfully retire with $1
